docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 17--The General Assembly elected Brazil, Morocco, Norway and the Philippines today to nonpermanent seats in the Security Council. They will replace Chile, the United Arab Republic, Ireland and Rumania, respectively.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 17--The General Assembly elected Brazil, Morocco, Norway and the Philippines today to nonpermanent seats in the Security Council. They will replace Chile, the United Arab Republic, Ireland and Rumania, respectively.
docs.abstract: Morocco defeats Nigeria for seat to replace UAR; vote is 73-35 on 2d ballot; Assembly also elects Brazil to replace Chile, Norway to replace Ireland; elects Philippines to 2d yr of term held by Rumania

headline.main: MOROCCO DEFEATS NIGERIA AND GETS U.N. COUNCIL SEAT; Sub-Sahara Africa's Drive Fails--Brazil, Norway and Philippines Also Elected MOROCCO DEFEATS NIGERIA IN U.N.

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 21-- There is growing sympathy in South America toward the United States in its dealings with Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 21-- There is growing sympathy in South America toward the United States in its dealings with Cuba.
docs.abstract: survey finds Latin-Amer support for US rising, with backing for isolation of Castro, but not intervention

headline.main: Latins' Sympathy for U.S. Rises in Castro Dispute; Surveys Find Support for the Isolation of Cuba but Not for Armed Action-- Caribbean Countries Troubled LATINS' SYMPATHY FOR U.S. IS RISING

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 21--The Central American-Caribbean region is so preoccupied with the problem of Cuba that it is diverting attention from other pressing issues.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22-- United States armed forces have intervened openly in disputes on foreign soil in the Western Hemisphere at least 90 times in the last 164 years.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23-- The American republics formally authorized today "the use of armed force" to carry out the quarantine of Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23-- The American republics formally authorized today "the use of armed force" to carry out the quarantine of Cuba.
docs.abstract: OAS Council votes unanimously to back US action; Uruguay abstains but apparently only because instructions to its repr are delayed; several nations offer mil aid

headline.main: COUNCIL VOTE 19-0; Latins Act Quickly on Plea by Rusk--Use of Force Endorsed American Republics Endorse the Use of Force in Applying Cuban Quarantine O.A.S. VOTES 19-0 TO BACK U.S. PLAN Display of Hemisphere Unity Is Greatest Since 1945-- Key Victory for Rusk

byline.original: By TAD SZULC Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23--The United States blockade against ships delivering offensive weapons to Cuba will go into effect tomorrow at 2 P.M. Greenwich time (10 A.M. Eastern daylight time).
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23--The United States blockade against ships delivering offensive weapons to Cuba will go into effect tomorrow at 2 P.M. Greenwich time (10 A.M. Eastern daylight time).

headline.main: BLOCKADE BEGINS AT 10 A.M. TODAY; Proclamation Is Signed by Kennedy--McNamara Gets Power for Enforcement President Signs Proclamation Ordering Cuban Weapons Quarantine to Begin Today M'NAMARA GIVEN THE POWER TO ACT Missiles and Bombers Listed as Offensive Material to Be Kept From Havana
